verses.roman:
tata āha balo nūnaṁ
sa maṇiḥ śatadhanvanā
kasmiṁścit puruṣe nyastas
tam anveṣa puraṁ vraja

synonyms: tataḥ—then; āha—said; balaḥ—Lord Balarāma; nūnam—certainly; saḥ—that; maṇiḥ—jewel; śatadhanvanā—by Śatadhanvā; kasmiṁścit—with some particular; puruṣe—person; nyastaḥ—left; tam—him; anveṣa—search out; puram—to the city; vraja—go.
translation: To this Lord Balarāma replied, "Indeed, Śatadhanvā must have placed the jewel in the care of someone. You should return to Our city and find that person.
